San Franciscans will vote next week on a proposition to ban guns within their city.
 
 The proponants are stating they will use State gun registration information to confiscate the present legally owned firearms.
 
 For years, the NRA has stated that this is EXACTLY what these lists could be used for, despite the groups that have said "No, NEVER."
 
 Yes, NEVER.
 
 Never seems a very short time at this junction.

post_info.post_title: San Franciscans make the case AGAINST registration

 This is proposition H, right? This is just plain unconstitutional. People have argued for limitations on it but this outright banning of guns is against the second ammendment. The majority shouldn't be able to take away the rights from the minority. Just because the majority of people there don't want guns doesn't give them the right to take away the Constitutional rights of others.

 It passed. As a very liberal, gun control proponent friend of mine who's a SF resident emailed, 'Even though I dislike guns in my home, does this mean others who do exercise their constitutional right should now hand their guns directly to our thugs to save them time or let them buy their own?'
